conclusion: Use principle of time minimization in optics to find ratio v1/v2 for minimized travel time from A to B.
Identify paths and angles in figure related to time minimization, described by Snell's law.
Set up equations for total time T as sum of time on beach and time in sea: t1 = d1/v1, t2 = d2/v2.
Use trigonometry to express distances d1 and d2 in terms of angles and total distance AB using law of sines.
Minimize total time T = t1 + t2 using relationship between angles and distances.
Use Snell's law to find ratio of speeds v1/v2 that minimizes time, given by ratio of sines of complementary angles.
Calculate ratio v1/v2 using angles theta1 and theta2: v1/v2 = sin(theta1)/sin(theta2).
Determine correct ratio v1/v2 as sqrt(sin(alpha)/sin(beta) based on figure and principle of time minimization.
